before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"f43lu","text":"- Wear attire appropriate for constant re-entry into the water.\n- Check that a working seconds stopwatch is present..\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ul24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4460h","text":"This procedure is used for costal monitoring and has been tested along the majority of the coast of Mo'orea, French Polynesia; completed by UC Berkeley's Island Sustainability classes. This protocol includes steps to collect observation data regarding birds, costal armoring, and boats, along shoreline transects. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"22r1","text":"- Do not trample coral.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n818","text":"- Do not walk through private property, unless you have explicit authorization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bo4e","text":"- Write observations in a field notebook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4qj3","text":"- Take pictures to document your transect.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6up2f","text":"- Try interacting with people as soon as possible and explaining what you are doing/getting feedback.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"36qff","text":"- Gaia GPS mobile app","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6em6s","text":"- Field notebooks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i788","text":"- Stopwatch (with seconds)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40mn6","text":"- Water-appropriate shoes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d706","text":"- Tape-measurer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qa54","text":"- Pencil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mtkg","text":"Have two team-members start a track on GAIA GPS. Make sure both members have full battery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ggbt","text":"When you see a bird, record the number and identify whether the bird(s) is an egret or heron. Refer to the bird ID sheet, linked here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":129,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"90BF0D2EC52111EDB9660A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1g797VgQbXlEd6cmfwh1OZ378Q9xsHoN34ShO3ft_cis/edit?usp=sharing"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6ohgb","text":"Record the timestamp at the time you spotted the bird.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d98bu","text":"Start time-stamp as soon as the coastal profile changes or as soon as you are no longer able to monitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28cqd","text":"Walking along the shore, take a timestamp of any boats, canoes, jet skis, or other vessels on the water that are visible to you. Record under Time-Stamp using military time up to the millisecond.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbroa","text":"Walking along the shore or as close to the shore as possible, write down the timestamp of every water outlet walked by.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bt73b","text":"Try estimating the width of the outlet (in feet or meters. Write down the estimate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ffus","text":"At the end of the day, take a picture of your notebooks before data entry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9htvj","text":"When done tracking, save and export the track as a .gpx file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2c585","text":"After starting track recording, with the GAIA-App take a picture of the group’s hand-watch with seconds showing on the hand-watch (will help make sure time on watch and GPS time are synced).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk2gv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n031","text":"Record the coast types on the data sheet using the following categories: unArmored (no apparent human-made alteration), armRocks (armored coast w/ piles of rocks/stones), armSeaWall (armored coast cement/concrete wall), and armOther (other category of armored coast). When you encounter a perpendicular structure (dock/over-water bungalow/stone alignment), record a time-stamp and the type of perpendicular structure on the data sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bo2s","text":"Estimate the distance in meters from the coastal armoring to the shoreline and record on the data sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jp4c","text":"If a fishing vessel, ID each vessel as one of the following under fisherBoat: outrigger, motorboat, swim on-foot. Leave this section blank if not a fishing vessel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"felch","text":"Start a time-stamp if backtracking or if you left the coast and make note.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s26d","text":"If applicable, note the type of fishing gear under fisherGear: spear, line, or net.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pl56","text":"Mark if the water outlet is flowing and any other relevant observations about it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b025j","text":"Under fisherN, record the number of fishermen in the crew if applicable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7evnu","text":"Under vesselType, regardless of if the vessel is for fishing, ID the vessel from the following categories: closed-cabin motorboat, opened-cabin motorboat, tourist-operator motorboat, sailboat, jet-ski [indicate number of jet skis in ()].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5co4a","text":"Under anch-navigating, indicate whether the vessel (regardless of if it is fishing), is anchoring or navigating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0ehr","text":"Repeat for each new vessel spotted. Use a single entry for each vessel unless it is a group of jet skis which pass at the same timestamp. Indicate if you cannot see the gear in the fishing boat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Mo'orea Coastal Use Monitoring  Protocol
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"aaelk","text":"- Eels and stone fish may be present","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hb56","text":"- Remain wary of stray dogs (staying grouped and pretending to pick up a stone or stick to throw at them is a sufficient deterrent)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bleqh","text":"- Entering private property often happens by accident, be prepared with phrases in the local language to explain who you are","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
